findings.title: Reentrancy Risk in vTHOR::deposit()
findings.description: Violation of `checks-effects-interactions` principle in `vTHOR`'s `deposit()` function, allowing potential reentrancy attacks.

findings.title: Accommodation of approve() Idiosyncrasies
findings.description: The approve() function may have idiosyncrasies in certain token contracts, requiring a specific pattern of calls to mitigate a known race condition.

findings.title: Possible Fund Stealing From Approving Users
Possible Costly LPs From Improper vTHOR Initialization
findings.description: The `vTHOR` contract allows users to stake their funds to receive `vTHOR` token as shares. The staking users will get their pro-rata share based on their staked amount.
